scat prefab
Welcome     Gallery     Handbook


Manual page for scat_prefab(PL)

EXAMPLES 1 & 2

Left:	pl  -prefab scat  data=data1  x=2  y=3  


Right:	pl  -prefab scat  data=data1  x=2  y=3  id=1 \
	   xlbl="Total Ch"  ylbl="White Blood Cell Count"  corr=yes  


data1 file: 	A/J	1.39	331
		BALB/cJ	1.67	182
		C3H/HeJ	2.07	301
		..etc..

EXAMPLE 3

pl  -prefab scat  data=data3  x=2  y=6  err=3  xerr=7  corr=yes \
	  ptshape=triangle ptsize=0.08  ptcolor=red  "errcolor=gray(0.8)"

data3 file:
	129S1/SvImJ 0.4927 0.111 0.353 129S1/SvImJ 0.4080 0.0839 0.265
	A/J 0.5547 0.0768 0.243 A/J 0.6051 0.0656 0.207
	AKR/J 0.4125 0.0631 0.200 AKR/J 0.3653 0.0418 0.132
	...etc.



How to run these examples


DESCRIPTION

scat is a prefab for producing 2-D scatterplots with optional point labeling, correlation, regression line, and error bars. Based on proc scatterplot .


PARAMETERS

Standard prefab parameters are all supported. data, x and y are required.

corr which, if yes, will cause correlation and regression to be computed and displayed;

id, a data field holding a data point identifier string;

xerr, a data field holding values for horizontal error bars;

ptsym, ptcolor, and ptsize, which control the shape, color, radius, and fill style for the data points (see symboldetails ), default is filled blue circle of radius 0.04

corrcolor, the color for the regression line and correlation annotation (default green)

idcolor, the color for the id labels (default orange)

errcolor, the color for the error bars (default gray(0.7)).

cats may be specified as yes to indicate that X data will be processed as categories rather than continuous numerics.
